115322223111.content:
Erina Pendleton had never felt so revolted in all her life. Here she was cleaning her mouth out with puddle water while the most vile of villains screamed curses at her. Dio Brando was every bit the rapscallion. Arrogant and evil. Jojo had described him to her perfectly.

Just thinking of Jojo made her feel sick now. Dio had sullied her. Taken her first kiss away. How could she face him now? How could she face the man she loved and tell him he'll never be her first. Dio had essentially taken their blooming romance and killed it.

Now she was on her knees in the dirty, cleaning the taste of Dio out of her mouth with filthy puddle water. The very action only served to enrage him. His massive ego would not abide her actions. In his mind he was leagues above everyone else. In his mind she should be honored.

"How dare you!" he screamed, yanking the poor girl from the ground. Erina was scared and even Dio's entourage looked nervous. "I am the great Dio! How dare you disrespect me like so?! You should feel honored I gave someone as lowly as you the time of day!"

He sealed his insult by giving her a hardy slap across the face. This action caused Dio's entourage to go silent. Despite being a band of misfits, they had never actually struck a woman. There were simply some lines they just wouldn't cross.

The pain that shot through her was immense, but her resolve to get Dio's taste out of her mouth was stronger. Again she went back to washing her mouth out. Even if it made her situation worse, she had to. If she could she would teach this brute a lesson herself. But she lacked the strength.

If only she were bigger and stronger. She'd make Dio answer for his crimes against her and Jojo. If only she were just bigger. She closed her eyes tightly and continued to clean out her mouth. Had anyone been paying closer attention, they would've noticed the strange green substance in the puddle that made it's way into her mouth.

"Come on Dio. Let's get out of here." One of his "friends" suggested. The other's agreed. Dio was about to indulge them until he heard a violent and wet cough come from the downed blonde girl. No doubt choking on puddle water. It did Dio's heart good to see karma at work. It's what she deserved for rejecting his mighty kiss.

Before he left he might as well get one more jab in. With a wolf-like grin on his face he walked over to the downed girl who had suddenly stopped her thorough mouth cleaning. She yipped in shock briefly at being hoisted up by her elbow. Dio was about to give her a good verbal thrashing before his words suddenly died in his throat.

His instincts were all of a sudden screaming at him. Growing up in the slums had taught him many things before being adopted into the Joestar family. One was to trust his gut. But why was his gut telling him to run far away? And from Erina Pendleton no less? How could this girl even register on his danger scale?

That's when it hit him through the silence. He released her elbow once he made eye contact. It finally donned on him that he was no longer looking down at her, to be more precise he had to crane his eyes slightly upward to meet hers! WHAT! He could've sworn he was taller than her just a few minutes ago!

That's when a sound hit him. Like that of tearing fabric. He instinctively took a step back at he watched the blue dress of the girl start tearing in certain places. Just what was going on here? She must not have known because she looked just as confused as everyone else. Dio's eyes widened as yet another realization hit him. He was having to now crane his neck upward to maintain eye contact. Erina Pendleton was growing!

Erina couldn't make heads or tails of wat was going on. For a second or two she felt ill. The next her clothes began to feel tight against her skin. Then Dio was yanking her to her feet to no doubt further insult her. Then she was stunned into silence when he suddenly went silent. Did he get smaller all of sudden because last she checked she had to look up to meet his gaze, not the other way around.

It didn't stop there though. Her clothes began to feel even tighter until they finally started to give and rip apart. Dio and the world around her began to shrink. No! To be more accurate, she began to grow. But how? It wasn't physically possible to grow at such an alarming rate!

Her shoes were the next thing to give as they completely burst open, revealing her bare feet. She was scared now. How was this happening and how big would she get? Dio and company didn't even move as they were frozen in shock. Little by little they began to dwindle in her eyes as her height rose. She just kept growing and growing and growing and growing until finally it began to slow down.

Her height finally capped off at one-hundred feet tall. Her dress had long since been torn asunder and was now hanging off her like a skirt and bra. How that much survived she'd never know. She was massive. The tree down below barely reached above her ankle. This was unbelievable. She then remembered her desire by the puddle to be bigger and stronger. Was this a direct result of that wish? Did wishes really come true?

Down below, Dio and his "friends" were left stunned. Little Erina Pendleton had just grown into a giant. It was like something out of an phantasy epic. This defied all logic. She was massive. A monster. What else could she be?

Dio felt nothing but dread in the pit of his stomach. This what his instincts were warning him about. Erina had just become a threat like no other. Remembering his past transgressions towards her made his face go pale. He was afraid. Afraid of what she could now do to him once her own shock wore off. He needed to get out of here. Get help. Perhaps the people could chase away the monster with their torches and pitchforks?

Before Dio and Co, could even attempt an escape, a loud cough demanded their attention. They all gulped before breaking out into a cold sweat. Slowly but surely they all looked up to meet the bigger girl's face, She starred them all down with her hands on her hips and displeasure written all over her face.

"Going somewhere?"
115322223111.title: A Woman Scorned

115322223132311.content:
Yoshikage Kira was victorious. Fate once again smiled upon him as he was able to turn back the hands of time. Bites the dust was invincible. "HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!" the serial killer laughed. He was unrivaled, no one would ever threaten his tranquility again.

"I did it! I was able to return! I was able to activate bites the dust again!" He laughed to himself, his arms spread wide. "HAHAHAHAHAHA! I beat them all! I'm finally free! HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!"

The madman's manic laughter continued until it was interrupted by a strange sight... Birds? Or rather, how they flew past him. "What was that just now? Those birds flew in from behind me, and... Just what happened?"

Come to think of it. Something else was off. Yoshikage Kira found himself is some sort of back ally maze. "Come to think of it, this isn't the normal route I take to work... But if Bites the dust did turn back the hands of time by one hour then, then I should be on my way to work right now. What time is it?"

The killer in disguise pulled back his suit sleeve to find his wrist bare. It then dawned on him that he'd removed his watch earlier and placed it in his pocket. Reaching into the inner pocket of his suit he pulled out his watch, only to be left stunned.

It was impossible, but... "What is this!? Why is it broken!"

Indeed his watch was still smashed to pieces from his last encounter with Josuke and his band of merry men. In Kira's warped mind this made no sense. Nothing did at the moment.

"It's 8:29am! Bites the dust did go into effect again! The watch Hayato destroyed with Stray Cat should have returned to normal, too!" Kira freaked. This made no sense! Nothing made sense! Why was his watch still broken! He activated bites the dust again, didn't he!

Suddenly his world began to spin. He felt sick. He shut his eyes. Something was clearly wrong! But what was it!? What was amiss!?

"HAVE YOU FIGURED IT OUT YET!?" A voice asked. It sound familiar, powerful, and at the same time so far away. Slowly but surely the deranged STAND user opened his eyes and found that his surroundings had changed yet again. Instead of being in the maze like before he was now surrounded by two massive pale pillars. The ground beneath him had even changed to a pure shad of violet. Was this some sort of carpet? Just where was he now?

Not thinking much of it the killer walked up to one of the pillars and rubbed his hand against it. It felt odd. Not like hard stone but instead soft and smooth. It left Kira with more questions than answers. Just what kind of pillars were these? "What on earth is going on here?" he whispered.

Things were getting way too bizarre for his liking. He had no idea where he was, his watch was still broken, and then their was that strange voice. Kira couldn't process properly what was happening... All he knew for certain was it was time to leave... Wherever the hell this was.

Before he could take another step he heard the telltale sound of the voice again. "SO THE KOSAKU KAWAJIRI THAT ROHAN TOOK A PICTURE OF WAS ACTUALLY IN FACT, YOSHIKAGE KIRA... AND THAT MEANS IT'S FINALLY OVER, DOESN'T IT!?"

Kira was freaking out now. Where was that voice coming from? He frantically began to search around his surroundings before finally looking up. Once he did he instantly regretted it. Sweat began to pour down his face as he began to back away. It was another pale pillar that reached up high into the sky. A sky that was now being blocked out by... A giant face.

"THEY FINALLY MANAGED TO CORNER YOU, YOSHIKAGE KIRA!"

The sight was so unreal, Kira actually fell back. This was a girl, a giant young woman. This defied all the laws of reality, even to a STAND user like himself. "W-wha…? Who are you!?"

It was a valid question. He didn't know her but she obviously knew him.

"YOU DON'T REMEMBER ME? I GUESS THAT'S UNDERSTANDABLE. FIFTEEN YEARS IS A LONG TIME. OH WELL. IT DOESN'T MATTER! YOU'RE HERE NOW... AND ALL MINE." the girl said emotionlessly. "IS MY SANDAL COMFORTABLE?"

Sandal, Kira wondered. He then looked closer and the violet floor he was on, and the two pale pillars that surrounded him. It then suddenly cliqued. He was tiny, and he was sitting in between this girl's toes. WHAT THE HELL!

Kira gulped nervously. Things weren't looking too good for him. "W-what are your intensions for me!?"

What were her intensions indeed?

12131.content:
Unsure of where you are, you glimpse around to get a grip on your surroundings. All you can see is a long plain of red, though you knew right away it was not grass. It felt too soft and smelled too clean. Your vision cleared up more and you saw a tower...no, a chair?

"What in the...?" you ask, "Is that...a giant chair? Am I..."

Yep. You were roughly the size of a Lilliputtian, but without the grotesquely enlarged head. You were obviously in a girls room, judging by the now-visible pinkish purple walls. And from the corridor of those walls came something that made you tremble...a giant girl! The giant in question had long blonde hair and wore her signature jacket and boots. She didn't seem to notice you until she bent down to pick up her earring...a giant diamond that you just now realized was right behind you.

"What?" asked Pacifica, "Is that...a tiny person?"

12312.content:
Another day, another opportunity for disappointment and adventure for Timmy Turner. Coming back from school, he was covered in what seemed to be glue and feathers as Francis decided to replace him for the school pinata they had set up for the International Festival Day. Groaning from the pain, he entered his room as Cosmo poofed up.

"Hey there champ, why so glum?"

"Being a pinata is one of the worst lives to ever live," Timmy groaned as he laid on his bed.

"Oh boy, you tell me, I covered once for my friend Stretcho the Clown Fairy, and it wasn't as fun as I thought it would be," Cosmo said with a hint of shivering in his voice.

"The only good thing I can get from this was," Timmy sighed in happiness, "Was seeing Trixie hit me with the bat. She looked so graceful and beautiful as she beat me up for candy." It wasn't a secret that Timmy had a crush on Trixie for the longest time, it was so strong that he would even endure any pain given to him, especially if it was from her!

Cosmo looked at this and was conjuring up an idea he had. A terrible one as Wanda would put it. But she wasn't around at the moment, Cosmo had all custody in fulfilling Timmy's wishes.

"So you wouldn't mind if Trixie was the one hurting you then?" He asked mischievously.

"Well uh...no, heck I wouldn't mind what she would do to me, as long as she did it," jumping from the bed in an excited stance as all the pain he felt had simply vanished.

"Well then sport," Cosmo said as his wand glowed, "Do I have a show for you!"

"Then go ahead Cosmo, I wish you did whatever you had in plan for me!" And with that the wand glowed and flash. Quickly running to the window, Timmy stared at Trixie's house across the street as he waited for whatever was going to happen.

Meanwhile inside her home, Trixie was laying on her bed, disposing of all the fan mail she had received and just....admiring herself for the most part. Not a worry in her world, except her world was to change in a drastic way.

She suddenly felt a strange tingling sensation across her body. With no time to react she quickly hit her head on her ceiling, "Ow, what the-" She didn't get to finish as she felt her body become...maturer. Her hip became curvier, her legs longer and sleeker, while her breasts began to rose. Wanting to question once more, she didn't get a chance as she sprouted once again crashing out of her home and demolishing her house with the rest of her body.

Looking confused, she looked around noticing that she had grown to quite the size of a hundred feet or so. Meanwhile,

"Cosmo, what did you do?!" Timmy furiously asked.

"Oh you now, just grew the love of your life into a smoking, irresistible, giantess." He said nonchalantly.

"But what about-"

"Fairy magic, you really think I was gonna allow anyone to die? It's against Da Rulez anyways," He said as he poofed the giant book and showed the exact rule right there.

"Oh, well....in that case then..." Timmy was pondering what to do and so was Trixie at her sudden change.

1231222.content:
She took a step into the street, cracking it down immediately as she took another. Her boot alone covered the width of two lanes, adding only giddiness to the already beautiful pre-teen. Although her body looked more mature, her mind was still that of her young self-resulting in very unpredictable actions.

As she walked away, causing more potholes than any rain would ever make, Timmy couldn't help but stare as Trixie swung her hips with each step. Was that she always did, or was he just noticing? Nevermind that, he quickly turned to Cosmo and pulled him by his shirt, "We need to keep an eye on her, who knows what could happen?!"

"Oh relax," Cosmo assured him, "like Da Rulez say, no death, so there's no possible way anyone can die."
"Only, to be in a huge amounts of pain," he realized immediately with an annoyed Timmy staring at him, "Alright then, let's go." As they quickly turned into pursuit at the monolithic teen.

Trixie in the meantime couldn't help but be in amazement at her surroundings, everyone was looking up at her-fueling her ego even more-and it only helped with her enlarged breasts and curvier hips. She flaunted her beauty as she swing her hair with her hand, hearing a lot of whistling and cheering from the crowds.
Of course being focused on that, she tended not to watch her step. Incoming traffic was being demolished under her sole as they screamed, darkness would fall, feel the mother of all pressure, and then be over it.

No red splats or smears of blood where found, but you did find a lot of people with stars spinning over their head while others complained of the back pain they always suffered. Much like regular day to day life in Dimsdale. The greatest reaction was from the old cook, Crocker who was waiting in traffic as he beeped his horn at everyone. "Imbeciles move already! Can't you see I have important FAIRY GODPARENTS, catching to do," Saying that last line in his spastic movement.

As he took a swing of his coffee, he spit it out splashing on his eyes, "Ah My EYES!!!" Wiping them clean he then screamed, "AH MY GIANT STUDENT! Surely the work of FAIRY GODPARENTS!" Twitching once more only to be flatten by Trixie's boot in a second and then released by the next. A woozy and beaten Crocker crawled out from the flatten steel he used to call a car as he pointed out, "or...maybe it could have been one of my experiments running loose again," before passing out from pain.

Meanwhile, Timmy riding Cosmo as a bird could only barely keep up with the buxom brunette as every step widen the gap between them. "Cosmo anyway to stop this."
"Unless she gets tired of it, then no." Answering in his usual dopey self.

"Hmmm," Trixie pondered as she stopped for a minute, causing cars to crash into her boots and pile on. "New York is such a far distance from here," looking northeast as she could faintly see the outlines of other cities. "What I would do to get their faster," She pouted only to be rewarded with another familiar feeling, the same one she felt in her room.

"Uh oh," Cosmo said. "What, what is it?!" Timmy asked alarmed.
"Brace yourselves!" As he flew away from Trixie as fast as he could.

Trixie looked down at herself as she began to smile and feel glee. The cars piled next to her, where now being pushed away as if they were pebbles. Her line of sight was increasing as her head was reaching higher altitudes. The telephone lines began to snap as her body pressed against them as they could not take the pressure from her. Trixie placed her hands on her hips as she waited for her process to finish and just peered at the every shrinking world underneath her.

Soon from a hundred feet she expanded to that of two, then three, then four, and now reaching five hundred, perhaps even a tad bit more. But soon the process finished as she smiled and looked around, she thought she was big before, now this was the start of something.

With her new added size to her, Trixie observed the vast difference now. When she had first started her journey, she would be able to hold at least one car under her boots, possibly two. Now. She only had a grin on her face as she saw that her boots easily covered the highway she was standing on. People where no longer like dolls, but little bugs instead. Small and weak, while she was big and tall.

Still, she didn't mean to hurt them, but she also wanted to flaunt her power towards them. Being large was only fueling her ego even more, adding flames to what once was but just a little girl. Noticing how the little bugs where walking out and staring at her she cleared her throat to announce her new orders.
"Well since not all of you are running around like headless chickens, or ants," Her booming voice coming down unto them, soothing but with enough hints of power in it alone, "I would like to proclaim myself as Trixie: Your New Goddess, upon the dirt you walk in."

The people seemed confused at her statement, some even stupefied by it. Goddess? What was she talking about? Surely she couldn't be thinking that adding a few-hundred-feet to her size was going to add anything? Did she? They where about to converse over the topic until Trixie spoke again. "It may seem incredible-trust me I would know-but understand that it is the best option."

"You would have the honor of serving me and tending to all my needs." She said as she lifted one of her boots, placing it to a new area of the road, as the familiar crunching sound of cars and metal came back-amplified by five of course. "And don't worry, I'm a gentle goddess, and all I ask is for the outmost loyalty and servitude." She continued on with her cunning smile as she took another step closer to the crowd, as both her white boots blocked their paths to escape and left them in between them.

"However, if you don't obey me," She slightly shifted her booth, as some people quickly where taken down under it and where trapped. Others where pinned in half, trying to escape but couldn't as the pressure of the gigantic girl let nothing escape. "Well....you don't want to see me that way."

"So what do you choose, ants?" Asking as she tilted her upper body down.

Leaving the remote severely unattended and also leaving it in the worst possibles areas to leave a remote. I.e. the living room.

Vicky had kicked the front door of the house as she slumped herself into the living room couch. She knew her bosses weren't around to tell her anything, always either taking vacations or leaving their twerp alone. She thought nothing of them as she only saw them as a means to get easy money. Too easy. So easy, she could do whatever she wanted while she was here. Might as well, no one was gonna tell her no at this point. Leaning in to grab the remote to the television, she noticed the strange device.

"The heck is this," She said in her gruff voice as she quickly analyzed the thing. It looked like a remote, yet the strange dials on the sides and front threw her off as she never had seen any model like this before. She shrugged it off, believing it was probably a newer model that her idiot bosses bought just because it looked shiny. Leaning back unto her usual spot, she pointed the remote towards the television as she pressed the power button.

It was an immediate response, but basically, the TV had exploded in a flash of color and smoke as Vicky stood up rather quickly, thinking she had broken the device on accident. Worrying about her pay getting deducted, she quickly started to notice the smoke clearing away as the television was still there, only for it to be covered in weird pink fur. Stupefied by the result, she was reluctant to do anything as she picked up the controller once more and started to really analyze everything about it.

First she discovered the dials were named and separated, into power, intensity, and desire. A strange feature, but she shook it off as there was a pink fur tv in front of her. Slowly, she pointed the control again and pressed the power button once more. The television worked fine! Even turning on and playing shows, even though it would have been scientifically impossible. Vicky jaw dropped as she saw the apparatus work.

Looking down once more on the remote, she looked at it curiously, What else could it do?

She doubted it was only good for one thing. Messing once more with the dials she raised the desire dial all the way up, and the power one somewhere in the middle, along with the intensity one. Then, she pointed the remote towards the floor and thought of anything. "Hmm, some ice cream would be good now." She thought to herself as the remote glowed and immediately three large bowls of ice cream sundaes appeared. She grinned as she was very well pleased that the remote acted upon her commands.

Fiddling once more with the dials, she pointed the remote once more to the TV, wishing for it to be back to normal, and larger than it once was. Immediately did her command became true as the television not only was normal, but was a large curved flat screen displaying only the latest channels and shows. This only made Vicky's grin, grow even larger as she looked at the remote as if it where a miracle sent gift.

After spending a good few hours messing with it, she finally figured out the device had certain features to it.
One, it made anything she wished for real.
Two, the desire dial made the chances of it happening occur-which she always kept at maximum.
Three, the power one affected how strong that wish was going to be.
And finally, the intensity affected how much of an area it was going to affect.

Having this newfound information, she looked at herself in the mirror. Nature hadn't been kind to her, but with this new device, she could change that within a matter of seconds. But then she noticed the stairs leading up to the twerp's room, she could have some fun with this new power of hers. Oh decisions, decisions.

1312122.content:
Our story starts off on a warm summer day as the Chipettes are heading to an all you can eat buffet,, "Man I hope we get there soon." Eleanor says as she spins a soccer ball in her hands. Her sisters share a sigh as Britney says "Calm down Eleanor! We'll be there eventually." however all that does is get Eleanor to say "I'm so hungry I could eat my soccer ball!"

At this Eleanor's stomach growls in response apparently agreeing with it's owner "See, even my tummy agrees with me!" She says to which her siblings share a giggle as they say "Oh Eleanor..."

(Meanwhile in a unknown scientist's lab)

"Finally! My Grow 'o matic spritzer is complete!" The scientist says as he pours his concoction into a big sprayer, "Now to test it..." He trails off as he looks around for something to test his sprayer on, he then finds an apple. "Ah this should work." He says as he puts the apple on a table and sprays it.

Within seconds the apple grows larger then it was before, "Yes it works. Now to try it at full power!" At this the scientist aims the sprayer through an open window without realizing it and fires shooting out a huge cloud of smoke into the open sky, not know who the spray would effect.

(Back with the chipettes)

Britney and Jeanette giggle at the astonished look on their waitress' face as Eleanor finishes of her 16th plate of food onto a stack of plates beside her, "When you know Eleanor and her appetite as well as we do you don't even need a garbage disposal!" The siblings say together with a laugh.

Suddenly without warning the cloud of smoke from earlier appears, Everyone in the area quickly bolts all except for Eleanor who's to busy eating! "Ooooohhh! This is so good! Next I want 10 banana splits 5 sundaes *Chough* wait *chough Chough* what's *Chough Chough Chough* happening?"

Eleanor squeaks out as the cloud surrounds her, within seconds the smoke takes effect. "What's happening to our sister!!!" Eleanor's sisters shout out in horror as they notice that their sister's grown into a giant! "Girls help my appetite's out of control!" Eleanor says as she starts to clean out the buffet even moreso then before.

Afterwords Britney and Jeanette get their now giant sister out to the outskirts of town as to not cause any damage "What am I gonna do girls? Now that I've grown to this size my hunger grew as well!" Eleanor says beginning to panic, "Don't worry Eleanor we'll figure something out!"

After that...
1312122.title: Eleanor

13121222.content:
To the town's horror as well as Eleanor's she begins to go on a eating spree, within 10 - 20 minutes all of the town's food gets devoured. Eventually Britney and Jeanette see that their sister's hunger has taken over her mind and is making her eat the rest of the food she may have missed as well as the buildings they're in!

Eleanor looks down sadly as she notices her sisters looking at her in disapproval, "I'm sorry girls I couldn't help it, my hunger took over..." She says sadly, Her sisters take notice of this and try to cheer her up, "Don't be upset Eleanor. We're used to this. Don't worry we'll get you out of this! We promise!"

The two of them say to Eleanor which causes the giant girl to smile as she wipes a tear from her eye, "Thanks girls..." She trails off as her happiness quickly turns to worry as she notices the townspeople beginning to head to her armed with pitchforks and torches, "But you'd better hurry up and find an antidote fast, cause I don't know what the townspeople will do if they catch me!"

She says as she heads off to hide somewhere, with that the girls head off eventually the girls find the scientist that caused this mess in the first place (Although they don't know that) "Excuse me, but would you two happen to know about the giant chipmunk that showed up a while ago?"

The man asks as Britney says "Yeah she's our sister actually. Why do you ask?" The man smiles and says "Let's just say I think I know how to fix this mess." This gets the attention of the two girls very quickly as they shout "What HOW??" The man smiles at that as he begins to explain.

"From what I've heard there's a rare clove of garlic that can help your sister, but the thing is it's in the forest somewhere." Britney just says "Whatever let's just go find that garlic already!" The man puts his hands up in defense as he says "No. Where you two need to be is with your sister. I'll go get the garlic."

With that said the group separates, after a while the girls find their sister stuck between a rock & a hard place so to speak. "Eleanor!!" they shout as they come in between their sister & the townspeople to stop them from doing something stupid. "Wait everyone, Stop!" Britney shouts out getting everyone's attention.

"Listen everyone, this has all been a huge misunderstanding!" This causes the townspeople to mumble in confusion as Britney continues to explain, "There's someone coming with an antidote to what caused our sister to grow giant! All we need to do is wait for him." After about 20-30 minutes The man comes back with a giant clove of garlic trailing behind him.

The crowd looks on in shock at the man before he says "Hey Eleanor was it?" the man asks to which Eleanor nods "Well, Eleanor. Eat up!" The man shouts with a grunt as he flings the garlic upto the giant chipette, who catches it in her mouth and downs the thing in seconds. Now the only question left: Did the garlic do it's job?
13121222.title: Eleanor's hunger takes her on a eating spree!

131212222.content:
To the trio of chipmunks shock nothing happens, "What!!!" they all shout out as the Townspeople begin to go nuts. "You said that this would be fixed after she ate that garlic!" one of the townspeople shouts at the tiny chipmunks as they go over to the scientist to ask him why that didn't work.

"Why didn't the garlic work?" The girls ask the scientist oblivious to the fact that Eleanor is heading off to find more food, "I don't understand what went wrong." He says putting his hands up in defence as Jeanette says "Look you said the antidote was a clove of garlic right? You must have grabbed the wrong one."

The man nods at this and says "You may be right. The antidote should be in a giant patch of garlic somewhere on the other side of town." this makes the girls think up an idea, "How about this; Me & Jeanette'll go get the antidote while you focus on calming these people down." The man nods keeping his true intentions hidden well.

With that the girls the girls go off to do their thing, after that the man goes over to the townspeople and begins to speak "Listen everyone! Those chipmunks have deceived you! But I can help you, all you have to do is trust me." At this one of the townspeople then asks "Why should we trust you?" which gets the rest of the town mumbles in agreement.

The man just chuckles, "Because I have gifts!" at that a mountain of gifts show up behind him which makes the townspeople say "Okay we trust you."

(Meanwhile with Eleanor in the countryside)

With her footsteps booming causing causing destruction Eleanor picks up and swallows a bunch of grass, "Oh I can't stand it, the bigger I get the hungrier I become!" As she says this she notices a farmer riding a horse pulling a cart full of melons, "Mmmm, melons." Eleanor says as she begins to chase after them.

Unfortunately for them they can't out run Her at all and to their horror Eleanor picks up the cart and dumps all the melons into her mouth, "Yummy that really hit the spot." Eleanor says before letting out a mild tremor, back in the city the burp Eleanor let out just seconds ago is causing severe damage.

"Oh no! The burp quake is destroying our whole town!" Eleanor whom just came back into the city tries to apologize for her actions, "I..I didn't mean it honest! I'm sorry everyone!" She says before she lets out a louder and stronger burp that causes more damage and tremors, "OH EXCUSE ME!" She says as she covers her mouth in embarrassment.

After that Eleanor heads off to find more food, the mayor then shouts "Oh No she's headed for the ice cream factory!" Meanwhile Britney and Jeanette have found the actual antidote and are trying to race back to the city to save their sister, did they manage to make it in time?

1322211.content:
~*BBBBBBBBBBBBUUUUUUUUUUUURRRRRR-HHHHHHHHHOOOOOOOOOUUUUUUUUUUURRRRRPPPP PPPPPPPPPPP!*~

The ginger-haired woman was unable to prevent the unfathomable eructation that had seemingly been summoned from the lowest bowels of Hell. It forced her clamped cherry lips apart, making them quiver like bacon. The ones that could see the devastation quickly advancing toward them would have given the burp monikers such as ‘tornado’, ‘earthquake’, and even ‘tsunami’ & ‘nuclear bomb’. Each of them was very apt, as it had shared many similarities with all of them.

The belch itself was so powerful that every building within the surrounding city block was instantly demolished. People, animals, vehicles, and debris were sent flying for miles by the 1,000 mile per hour gales that April's burp produced. Many of them died from the whiplash, others had their bodies actually torn to shreds by the current, and more still from the collisions with the remaining structures and aforementioned debris. As the radius of destruction expanded, so too did the volume of the gaseous roar. All those closest to the recently enlarged giantess were spontaneously deafened, their eardrums exploding in a gush of liquid hemoglobin as the outer part of her belch formed a domed shockwave.

Even the very ground beneath Miss O’Neil’s giant feet was not safe. The vibrations made by her eructation connecting to the streets caused deeply buried sediment to be unearthed. Enormous cracks split open Times Square, the Empire State Building collapsed into the dark underground world, and the Chrysler Building tipped over, flattening the unfortunate souls in its way. New York’s ports fared no better, the fierce winds and chaotic shifting of rock whipping up the tallest, widest, and fastest tidal waves ever recorded in human history. Grimy sea vessels containing various trading goods, basic fishing boats with only a couple boarders, and even yachts housing the wealthy elite farther out at sea; all of them capsized , sending their occupants to a watery grave. Even the Statue of Liberty, one of THE symbols of the city easily recognizable around the world, could not withstand the unnatural disaster. The pedestal was first to go, any poor tourists visiting drowned in the tides. Then, the sea level rose, swiftly enveloping the copper woman’s little piggies and knees. After a few minutes, Lady Liberty was swallowed by the displaced New York Harbor.

~

Finally, after five ungodly minutes, the monstrous eructation had ended.

And what a sight there was to behold following it.

Not a single building was still erect in the aftermath, even the grandest skyscrapers were no more than rubble. The popular beaches resting near where the ocean once was were abandoned, no umbrellas or beach balls around to indicate that anyone was vacationing there. The waters themselves were completely gone, leaving a sandy barrier to separate the island of Manhattan from the rest of the state. In a few hours, the water would return to fill the gap, rushing in with enough force to flood the remains of the once thriving metropolis.

Whole city blocks were rendered tiny islands themselves, unconnected from each other by the giant abysses that were leagues in depth. It would be impossible to traverse such a fractured terrain. Long stretches of Sewer line were brought to the surface, spouting hundreds of gallons of filthy H2O. It’s safe to say that whatever beings dwelling in there were unlikely to have survived, maybe even the turtles had finally met their end. A thought that April would rather not focus, given the entire trauma that she’d have to endure afterwards.

However, the worst thing to come out of this was the ‘fallout’, so to speak. A thick cloud of sickly green fog descended unto the lifeless streets, so solid that any living being caught in it would be utterly unable to see a foot in front of them. That is, if the smell alone hadn’t blinded them with their own tears. Its scent was vomit-inducing amalgamation of hot dogs, pizza, burgers, milk, soda, stomach acid, and other unidentifiable substances. Mixing in with the fragrance of fresh corpses, it only served to enhance the odor.

And where was April following that havoc?

Sitting in a crater 100 feet in diameter and 50 feet deep, the 70 foot news reporter had her hands clasped over her mouth. Her whole face lit up in a shade of red that perfectly matched her hair and rivers of salty tears streamed past her cheeks.

“What have I done?”

The list of survivors was a very short one, but some were lucky enough to live another day. These fortunate few were…

As she reached the end of the pages though, she noticed something quite....strange that it caught her eye. A very, very, very tall giant, only it was a female. Phanty never heard of such things, but it was now, sparking her interest. She attentively read the titles as she absorbed every detail.

"Large and in charge!" The title read, "Massive woman on the rise, rest of the world falling down!" Noticing on how big the lady was as cities barely reached her legs, as she walked through a countryside not minding was underneath her. Phanty kept staring for quite a few minutes after she whispered to herself, "I wouldn't mind being that big..." And like that, a flashbulb of idea came, standing up from her position as she flew up and away to the library. Seeing if she could find anything on the topic of size change.

choices: "Creating potions is what I do best!"

1352312111.content:
The library was quite the typical creepy place to go to, a perfect location to find the information Phanty was looking for. As she passed through the walls, unaffected by its boundary, she quickly inspected every bookshelf and every book by spine!

Surely Miss Grimwood had to have something on spells to change size. Or something along those lines. "Salamander's body parts use, no. Salt and Vinegar, make everything richer, no. Sequential use of the Dark Arts, .....I'll read that one later." Browsing the gigantic catalog of books around the library. "Come on, there's gotta be at least something!" Picking up several books at once as she laid them out the table and began to quickly flip through them.

"Useless, useless, useless, useless," Phanty said as she read to several pages of history and social class commentary as she continued on her quest, "Who even reads this stuff?" Complaining as she tossed the book aside and continued on. This took about a good several hours as she had nearly read almost every book, or flipped through to be more precise, as she was finally about to give up. Reaching out for one of the last shelved ones, she opened up the table of contents to read, SIZEOMANCY, on the first page.

Quickly she opened to the page as she read up on what she needed to do. According to the book, there where many possible way to change one's size at will. It was very simple to reduce mass and matter, but very difficult to increase it. However, if achieved, it would be very potent and possibly unstable. Phanty only cackled as she continued to read, she was getting very excited by it. Moving on the specifics, since she was a ghost, there where two exact ways she could bloom up in size.
1.) She could gather some ingredients to create a potion potent enough to allow her to change, but only if the specific instructions where followed to the letter without any change.
or
2.) She could concentrate on gathering enough energy, to forcibly expand her body. The book described that electrical charges seemed to work best instead of gathering energy by sheer will.

Phanty stopped reading as she had a mischievous smile on her face. She had two choices, both sounding exciting, but which one to go with?

The Micrones don't tend to believe her
135231212222.content:
Elsa Frankenteen knew she was different. Not a bad different, but just enough she could differentiate herself from her friends. For one, she was taller. Much taller. And this only increased as they got older. She went from her ‘petite’ size of 5’ 10” to almost reaching the 8’ mark, even passing her father.

No one held it against her though, in fact they glorified the fact she was tall. Adding small blushes to the humble monstress.

In addition to her unusual height, Elsa had another strange feature added to her; her feet. Not only did she walk around barefoot all the time, but she also had the largest pairs of soles any ghoul would had ever seen.

So large, whenever her friends came over for a sleepover, they would be aghast at how both their feet made up one of Elsa’s. Easily did she win at footsies, and easily did she cover long distances. Even sasquatches would be outdone by her; and even though she could never find shoes to fit her massive feet, she didn't mind so much as she loved the feeling of the earth under her.

Atlas, adding to another feature to her. While being tall, strong and large, she had a peculiar sense of sole skin.

Although large and strong to withstand anything, they were also quite…petite. A strange word to associate Elsa with but throughout her years she eventually took notice of this feature.

During one of her morning walks along the countryside, she had taken a different route than her usual one. One that went through the woods near her home. She knew the area roughly as she walked around, but wasn't very familiar with the surroundings.

She did notice however how crunchy the path felt underneath her feet. Hearing multiple crunching sounds beneath her gave her a small laugh. Eventually she continued on home, entering her room, propping herself in a chair, only to have a surprise that spooked even her.

Lifting her foot over her leg, she was about to wipe the dirt off her sole, when she noticed some peculiar black dots. Barely visible to the naked eye and where only noticed by Elsa’s modified irises. Looking more closely at it. She gasped at what she saw.

There were small creatures, very keen on the word small, all over her sole. So small they could have easily mistaken for dirt or pollen. But that's not what she gasped at. Instead she had gasped at the barely audible cries. Of course this perplexed her, she couldn't have heard it, right? She may had been a monster but there was such a thing as ridiculousness.

Using her index finger, she scooped up these dots, as she brought them closely to her eye.

There under her fingernail stood …humans. Or more specifically, a cross of humans and dwarven people who happened to be the size of microbes.

She almost dropped them, if it weren't for her fingers rough texture giving them a very tight grip. After getting her conscience however, she did manage to gather them on her desk as she placed her feet on it and slightly shook them for the populace to fall down.

Afterwards though she had many questions on what they specifically where and how they got there. And how they weren't grapes under her as well.

Evidently they were surprised as well why they weren't in a state of smears as well. Nevertheless, what appeared to be the leader of the tribe, walked up and spoke to Elsa. “Oh great being of power, please have mercy on us!”

She held back a laugh but managed to give a good response, “What makes you think im casting judgment on you?”

“Well didn't you come to destroy our great civilization?”

“Uuuuhhhhh, no. Heck I didn't think people this small existed until today.”

This perplexed the small leader, making Elsa smirk at his reaction. “Well where are my manners, i'm Elsa Frankenteen, and you are?”

“Erasmus, leader of the Microne people for the moment.”

“Microne? “

“Yes,” he then explained, “We are not in official records of any kind as we wanted our existence to be hidden from the rest of the world.”

“And why is that?”

“Well when your as small as dust, you tend to get paranoid and be more uptight on securing the safety of your own people. And with your recent...display, I believe we will have to move again.”

Elsa then winced as he mentioned her walk,”Yeah sorry about that.”

“Do not worry, we had accepted our fate the moment the ground trembled and your massive form stepped in the middle of our small city.” This was only making Elsa feel a bit worse. “Nevertheless may I ask you for favor?”

“Sure, what is it?” Leaning forward as she was excited to help, making Erasmus a bit uneasy.

“Uh...could you...possibly be able to gather the rest of the villagers and bring them here? You were only able to bring a majority of us when you passed.”

“Sure but...um..how do I get them over here?”

“Either mention me and the rest of us as being safe, or…well..the same way you brought us.” Elsa nodded as she stood up, the shin of her legs only being visible to the Micrones now. "Don't worry, I'll try to do my best!" And with that she took off, every step making the Micrones jump in the air as she left her room and walked outside. It was still pretty strange for her to accept that such people existed in the first place, but then again, she was the daughter of one of the most iconic monsters in history, her friends were also daughters of all sorts of types of iconic creatures, and her teacher was a witch that new all sorts of potions and spells-with a pet dragon. So...not too strange, but not what she was expecting either.

Meanwhile back in the Microne city, the villagers and citizens remaining were trying to rebuild and accept a bit of the loss that they had just received. However, they weren't able to relax so easily, as the familiar tremors were coming back. Putting them into a state of frenzy.

It wasn't hard for Elsa to trace her steps back to the road she took, but this time she did take precautions in where she was stepping and she looked down on the ground until eventually she reached an area with leaves and small sticks surrounding it in a circular way, while small shells and rocks stood in the middle, extending outward. "Huh," Elsa said as she stopped at the edge of the border as the "walls" barely reached her toes, "Not sure how I missed that in the first place."

Back with the survivors, they were panicking as the destroyer returned. Fearing their lives, they ran in opposite directions, hoping to escape the wrath of the giantess coming to finish them off. But as they awaited a devastating end, they instead heard, "Uh excuse me," leaving them confused.

Elsa immediately noticed the small dots running around. There were definitely Micrones down there, but they were deeply afraid of her and at the point of trying to move away as fast as they could. "Uh, excuse me," she spoke, getting some of their attention. It was a start. "Excuse me, but somebody called Erasmus told me to come and pick all of you up. I'm extremely sorry for what I did, really I am, but I'm willing to make it up to you. So if you could please all gather to be picked up, that would be great."
135231212222.title: Elsa and the small discovery

choices: "Yes child, you have gained our trust."
1352312122222.content:
"She lies!" One of the Micrones said, "She's come to kill us all!" Immediately getting the crowds to panic once more as they ran everywhere to get away from the monstrous girl.

"Wait, no I'm actuall-" "RUN AWAY!" "Listen I'm tryin-" "SAVE YOURSELVES!" Elsa just sighed and face palmed as it was hopeless to get any of them to listen to her after that one comment. "Welp, I really wanted to avoid this," lifting her foot over the village, "but I guess this is the only way your going to listen," immediately dropping it down.

The settlers screamed as they saw the massive sole come down. They were sure their lives were about to be extinguished that they stood there and prayed their misery would be quick and painless. Elsa's sole covered the entire city, or mostly the area that was most populated, feeling the fragile structures get diminished and the Micrones quickly come into contact with her. As she stepped down, she couldn't help but smirk a bit, knowing that everything would have been fine, even though her size had clearly pointed at the opposite.

And as the villagers awaited their deaths, noticing the dark shadow come down, along with their homes being destroyed and their friends disappearing in front of them, they were surprised to find themselves....alive. Surely this must have been only their denial and cling towards life, but each second they spend under and engulfed by her sole the more they had realized they weren't gone.

Elsa smiled, feeling the small crowd getting stuck. Lifting her foot to check, the populace that had been under her were now firmly secure. There were still some running around but she wouldn't let them get away either. Still for safety reasons, she lifted her foot up to check if everyone had been firmly stuck.

The Micrones were in for wild ride as they were lifted from the ground up into the air and blinded from the extreme change from light to dark. Suddenly they viewed the face of the girl that had come to torture them, only she was smiling-and given their situation-it was a reassuring one. "See I told you," Elsa informed as she was relieved they were safe. Even managed to find the one person who had panicked everyone, "Your gonna owe me later you hear." Sticking out her tongue as the micro person nodded his head quickly. She laughed a bit but got back to business as she pressed her foot down again and scanned the area for anyone left.

Quickly she found some running away from the village as she lifted her other foot over them and brought it down, "Not so fast," she teased. She had to admit it was getting quite fun. Turning around she found a few more standing in the middle of the city as if they had given up on the situation and admitted defeat. A "small" press from her left foot and immediately they were added to her rescue. Now to just look sweep the area once more.

Looking around carefully, it seemed she had gathered everyone under her feet. She was quite amazed by that, but then again, she did steam roll through her first visit, so she was kinda half and half about it. Regardless, she was glad that she had done her job, and with one last checkup of her passengers, she was off towards her home. Hopefully Erasmus wouldn't be too mad at her.

Back at her home, the Micrones were conversing one another on what to do about their situation. With their location discovered, there was no possibility to return to it as it had become far to dangerous. And with the giant girl, Elsa, knowing about them-would she let them go knowing this information? It was a very long debate, one that had started as soon as Elsa had left the room. Nevertheless, they quickly fell silent as they felt the familiar tremor come back again, louder each time.

Everyone began to jump with each step as the large form of Elsa returned to the room. It was still terrifying for them to see her. Even from the door, she was already massive and only grew in comparison as the table they were in seemed to dwindle in size as she approached. Finally Elsa was in view of them, or more specifically her shins, as she called for Erasmus.

"Hey Erasmus I'm back!"

"Yes we noticed about five steps ago," a grumpy Erasmus came forward as he got his footing back, "So did you manage to convince the remaining villagers to come."

"Well...." "They panicked didn't they," "Yeah." Erasmus sighed, "Well it's what I thought would have happened, just wish it didn't.

"Now hold on, I did manage to convince them that I didn't mean any harm through demonstration and for the majority, it seemed to work." Elsa said as she really didn't want to lose the trust of these really small people.

"Oh really, well do you mind if we ask them ourselves?"

"Sure! Just..uh...let me sit down first." Elsa pulled the chair she was sitting on and sat down, creating a massive wave of air that blew over all the Micrones and let them to fall once more. Next, she brought up her feet unto the table, careful to place them as comfortably close towards the Micrones as possible as she once again repeated her tapping from before.

Some had winced as she brought her feet close once more, while others marveled at how big they were-making them feel...well smaller than usual. Nevertheless, the members of their tribe coming down safely unto the wood, broke their trance as they quickly went to embrace their friends and family who otherwise had seemed to be lost forever.

Elsa removed her feet as she was done and was glad to see such reunions being made. Made her feel a bit warm inside her mechanical heart. However she did clear her throat as she wanted to get their attention once more. "So can I be trustworthy now?"

14121.content:
It was a hot summer day in the island of Hawaii. As per usual the local citizens and fauna woke up from their peaceful homes and into either work or school.
Humans and aliens, finally living together and helping each other out. Such was even the case, that they lived with one another, like back in the Pelekai manor. It was loud, moving, and even a bit chaotic, but it was a regular day for the denizens of the home.

Lilo and her companion Stitch excited the house, excited to see either a new experiment or just have fun, in general. Pleakley, being his....strange self, had obsessed over one general new thing now and began to search as much information on it, while Jumba tinkered away with another new gadget(s). This left, Nani, the eldest of the two Pelekais, and the de facto head of the house. She was cleaning the left over breakfast from the family, as she took out garbage, started up the washing machine and was now vacuuming the living room. She was a simple woman, not quite asking for much, just enough money to pay her bills, watch over her family and have a little bit of fun here and there. Then again, with alien technology installed to her home, it wasn't like she was paying much of taxes as of recent.

Still she did not mind having a little adventure here and there, but she usually reserved herself from it or it was taken by her little sister before she could say anything. She sighed as she had finished the vacuum cleaner as she sat down on the couch, all was well for the moment.

"Aaaahhhh, Big Sister of Little Girl!" For about a few minutes as she opened her eyes as Jumba was in the frame of the hallway, "I require for you to be...assistant."
Nani perked up as she lifted an eyebrow.

"Assistant?" She asked as she stood up, "Jumba you don't usually ask me for experimental help."

"Yes, yes, but...." He waved his hand in the air, "I think this would be....experiment you might enjoy." He said as she urged her to follow him.

"Alright, alright," Nani said as she rolled her eyes, "But if something bad happens, you're giving the TV a new upgrade, I'm urging to see some of those new dramas on the foreign channels." She followed Jumba down towards his makeshift lab in his room, made out of old gadgets he had or made from the spare junkyard on Hawaii. The room was filled with the things but none of them were important as Jumba lead Nani to the desk he was in, showing her....what appeared to be black...cuffs of some kind

Nani looked at them with curiosity. They definitely were cuffs as they were circular in shape, glowed green from the inside as Jumba tweaked them, and were five in total. She was quite confused what they were for until she had to ask, "Don't tell me you've been taking fashion advice from Pleakley!"

"Of course not!" Jumba retorted as he chuckled at the joke, "I've been doing more than that actually." Checking to see if his invention was in sync with the others as one cuff began to glow and so did all the other in that faint green light. "Now here, please put on."

"Why?" Nani said as she was curious what he was up to.

"It is for experiment, I assure you, 100% non-lethal!" He affirmed as he once again brought the cuffs to her.

She sighed, "Fine," extending her arms as Jumba began to apply the cuffs around her wrists, they were quite good to the touch actually. Not too heavy, or comfortable, almost as if they were lighter than they were made. He slowly made his way around her neck, only for Nani to stop him. "I think I'll do this one." Jumba only sighed as he gave Nani the next cuff as he let the device wrap around her neck, adjusting to her size as it once again was put on snugly. Odd thing for a machine to do.

"And now...uh..." Jumba stuttered a bit as he had the last two left. He shook his head as he put on his professional face, "You must put this around ankles as well." Handing the devices to Nani as he knew she was going to be a bit hostile if he had done it herself. Nani only sighed once more as she reached down towards her sandal feet as she let the cuffs lock into place. Once she was finished the five devices began to glow as they synchronized with one another. "Okay now what?"

"Hang on," Jumba said as he looked into his computer to make sure the devices were correct. Once it gave him the all clear, he instructed her, "Outside we must go! Unless you want house to be destroyed." He said as Nani smirked at the idea, "Like that hasn't happened." Nevertheless, they were outside, Jumba looking up at the skies as he made a bit of calculations while Nani followed him still wondering what this was all about.

"Alright, I think you can explain to me now, why we are doing this?" She asked as she crossed her arms in front of him while he still looked up.

"Of course, of course," He looked down, jotting some notes as he explained. "The simple answer is," He leaned in, "Today we are testing growth bracelets."

Nani stood quiet, before bursting out laughing. "You can't be serious right?" She was holding her stomach as she continued only for Jumba to shake his head.

"No, no, no, it is true. I must find way for you to grow!"

"Oh really, why?"

Jumba stood quiet for a bit, before answering. "Because......Earth Lady would look nice while big." Nani stood stupefied by the answer. She didn't know what to say, she was not expecting this after all the things she had witnessed. Nevertheless, she was already in the get up and the idea was interesting at least....

"Alright," she said after a few moment of silence, "I'll do it. BUT! You have to promise me, nothing bad will happen."

"Oh do not worry!" Jumba replied as he was adjusting some settings on his device to begin the process. "I have made sure, everything is safe and secure!"

"Okay!" She took a deep breath as she closed her eyes, "Just tell me when to begin!"
"And when to open my eyes!"

"Initiation!" Jumba yelled out as he inscribed some numbers. "Countdown, 5, 4, 3, 2, 1...." He pressed a button on his wrist watch as the cuffs beeped and a light engulfed Nani. Her frame visible getting larger and larger by the second. Yet how much, it was unknown. They were testing them for a reason.

14123.content:
It was a regular day in Hawaii, as regular as aliens who lived in peoples' home was.

Nevertheless, Jumba was messing around in his lab. Developing new sciences as he now worked for the secret agency that Mr. Bubbles worked for.
Tinkering away at his latest device, he failed to notice the two smaller members of the family, sneak in as they leaned in to see what he was working on.

"Just needs a bit more calibration, a few new wires, and..."

"What's that supposed to be?" Jumba almost jumped out of his chair as he turned around to see Lilo leaning against him, trying to see whatever he was working on.

"Small child, don't scare me like that, you almost make me blow up the entire house," He mumbled as he turned around again and continued on his work. Only to find Stitch chewing on one of the wires. "626, get out of there!" He grabbed Stitch by the legs as he pulled him away from his apparatus and was relieved to see no damage on it.

"You didn't answer my question Jumba," Lilo said as she put her hands on her hips, Stitch rolling next to her as he stared at his creator as well. Jumba did some minor fixes here, as sparks flew away from his tools. Setting them down, he spoke.

"You see child, this is new technology I am working on. Able to diminish the matter and mass of items." Showing off the weird dome contraption with wires under it and lights emitting as well.

"So, it shrinks things?"

"In short, yes." He said setting it down to test it. "Stand back however, it's highly dangerous, haven't tested it out yet." He pressed some buttons as the machine buzzed to life only to power down. "Bah, blasted thing is broken." Shaking his arms up in the air as he went back to the desk to check what had gone wrong.

Meanwhile, Lilo and Stitch approached the item as they inspected what could have caused such failure. "You think he forgot to install the battery again?" Lilo asked her blue companion. Stitch shrugged as he began to pull some wires and mess with the machine. He spouted his usual gibberish while Lilo observed. At that moment, Pleakley came inside the room as well.

"Hey, what are you all doing?" He said as he approached the machine.

"Trying out Jumba's new machine, but he's having some problems," Lilo explained as Stitch was now re-routing wires left and right.

"I don't think you should be doing that," Pleakley said as he was trying to move Stitch to no avail.

"Come on Stitch, stop touching!" Lilo joined on the pulling as the blue fur ball was being persistent. Jumba turned around and was mortified to see everyone on his machine.

"NO STOP, GET OUT-" He moved in to push them off, but as soon as he did that, the machine started buzzing around, coming back to life as it filled the room with green light. The four residents where blinded by it as it flashed before their eyes, only to subdue itself within seconds.

"What...happened?" Lilo said, as she grabbed her head. "Stitch? Jumba? Pleakley?!" The little girl was worried as her head was throbbing but was relieved to hear the ramblings of Stitch as he came running to her, to a quick hug. "Where are the others?"

"Right here," Jumba said as Pleakley joined.

"Care to explain?" Pleakley asked.

"Simple, I told you not to touch it, you did, and now the device has shrunk us down, to small size." As he explained, did they soon start to realize just how the environment around them had changed. The device itself was like a mountain overshadowing them. The ceiling was miles away from their position. The floor stretched on and on forever. While the furniture, was another towering fortress on themselves. "Very small size."

Just before they could do anything, did they hear a distant sound.

Thoom...

And then again, but louder.

Thooom...

"What is that?" Lilo asked scared.

"LILO, ARE YOU HOME?!" A thundering and familiar voice could be heard in the distance. All of them started to panic as they realized who was coming.

The door opened, letting in a huge gust of wind down unto the party. There, standing on the frame, stood the monolithic tanned figure of Nani...
14123.title: One or more people are micro shrunk (unaware)

141231.content:
“Lilo? Stitch?” Nani asked as she looked inside the room. It was odd, usually the house would had been buzzing with noise but it was awfully quiet. “Guess they must be out,” Nani said as she took a few steps forward and noticed the strange dome device. “Must be Jumba’s,” she said as she reached down for it.

Meanwhile, the small heroes were panicking. Running away from Nani as this hadn't been the first time this situation had happened. Only this time they weren't the size of bugs, but much smaller than that. They jumped in mid air as Nani's steps came closer, louder and more powerful than the last.

"Quickly grab the machine!" Jumba yelled as he had installed smart compartments if such occasion had occurred. They split up as they entered the nearest slips and grabbed on to whatever they could. Lilo and Stitch occupied one and Jumba and Plekley, the other. They held their breaths as the loud thuds stopped hitting the ground until they heard, "MUST BE JUMBA'S,"and where quickly lifted into the air.

They had all screamed for their lives as they grabbed to small railings around the edges of their safe zones. Praying they wouldn't fall and fearing their lives.

Meanwhile Nani was just inspecting the machine, noticing all the strange wiring and machinery. "I have no idea what Jumba would use this for," shaking it a bit to see if there were any loose ends or bits. Back with our heroes, they held on tightly, feeling the vertigo of rising up as they felt the violent movement of the shake. 1451121.content:
Ariel swam on a little more cautiously. She was dimly aware of the power she possessed, the unintended destruction she could cause, and how frightful her size could be, but was still too excited to it much thought.

Instead she imagined a city of humans who would star admiringly at her, while she'd get to there wondeorus dwellings, and more of those strange artefacts she liked to collect.

As she neared the human's land, she arose from the sea and swam slower, not wishing to cause any unintended destruction.

The first thing that caught her eyes were the human city. The most remarkable thing about it was how much it was like Atlantis, albeit with larger dwellings and less extravagant designs. The palace didn't even sparkle, yet there was a certain appeal to it.

There was also a lot more greenery, and many different trees and plants Ariel had never seen before. The human world possessed such beauty!

Forgetting her surroundings, she sped forward, inadvertently creating another wave.

She was distracted from her sight seeing, by numerous shouts and voices. More humans! So many different size and shaped humans, including females!

However, they were frightened of the strange creature that had swam to their shore.

"Don't be afraid!" Ariel said, louder than she had intended. "I just want to see your world and meet some humans! I'm not going to hurt anyone!"

She wasn't sure her words were going to convince anyone. She lowered herself, hoping to appear less imposing, and scanned the humans for anyone who might not be afraid of her.

Arial gasped. Approaching the city was a large squid like monster, roughly her size but a good deal broader.

"A Kraken! They don't normally come this close!"

"I'll drive it away!" Arial said, picking up a ship , brandishing it as thought it was a club. She held As she prepared to fight, doubt stung her. She wanted to protect the human city and finally convince the humans she was friendly, but how could she fight such a monster?

It waved its tentacles in all directions. No part of it seemed open or vulnerable.

She circled around it, drawing it away from the city and eyeing it for any weakness. Arial had never had to fight, Trition saw no reason to train her and she was the friend of almost everything under the sea, save the odd hungry shark she preferred to run from.

Maybe she could avoid fighting it. She raised her other, the one not carrying her makeshift wepon.

"We don't have to fight, but please don't hurt these humans! If you come with me I can find you somewhere fun to play!" She swam away from the city, hoping it would her, but it merely lunged at Arial. Arial gasped, narrowly dodging the tentacle.

Did it not understand Her? Or was it refusing to listen?

"Please listen to me! We don't have to fight, I just don't want you to hurt the humans."

Again it tried to grab her, though Arial kept swimming it. The Kraken had trouble turning as quickly as her and following her movements with it's one beady eye.

Good. It was bigger than her, but it wasn't as fast or as good a swimmer.

Ariel swam around it, going faster and faster, diving under the water or swerving to dodge it's tentacles. The monster tried to keep up with her, but as she continued increasing her speed it got hard and harder for it to track her. Soon Arial could see the monster was dizzy and disorientated, clumsily flailing it's limbs around. This was her chance!

She dived down and swam it like a torpedo, Then swung the ship at the beast's head, the way one would use. The hit made a powerful crack and the Kraken screamed.

The blow was not fatal, but Arial did not wish it to be. The monster howled in pain and while it recoiled in pain, Arial grabbed the ship and swam away from it.

She turned back to it, still holding her weapon. The monster still howled, and rubbed it's wound with one tentacle. Ariel raised the ship.

"There's more where that came from!"

As she hoped, The monster turned and swam away, as quickly as it could.

She called after it

"And don't come back here again!"

Behind her, Arial could hear the cheering, it was like music to her ears. She turned to face the adoring crowd.

Arial had never tasted food like this! So many different flavors, so many different textures, it seems humans inventiveness did not stop at their buildings, clothes or strange trinkets.

She didn't worry about gobbling it all up, it was all so new and wonderful to her, and at her size she figure she probably needed a lot of food. It had tasted wonderful going down, but now she was regretting it. Arial felt an increasing pressure in her stomach and before she knew it she let out a loud belch.

"Oh excuse me!"

But either as a result of her size or the Trident's power flowing into her, her belch had a strange effect. It echoed out and shook the city, like a mini earthquake. Buildings rocked, people feel and the ground shook

Arial gasped.

"Oh I'm sorry! I didn't mean to-" She stopped, feeling a lump in her throat for a second that stopped her speaking. When she opened her mouth she hiccuped, But it was louder than even her great size would suggest and seemed to echo around. To Arial's horror the town shook more severely from this, as though it was being struck by a fool scale earthquake.

"Sorry! I swear I'm not doing this on- HICK!" She hiccuped again with the same effect. Shouts and screams filled the air and the land looked like it might break apart. She put her hand over her mouth, but could feel another hiccup building. Arial knew she had to get out of there.

She dived under the water and sped away. Sure enough, another hiccup came, shaking the ocean. Swimming on a full stomach didn't make her feel any better, and certainly didn't help her hiccups, which continued to rock the ocean, but she couldn't stay and ravage the world she so loved.

The trident! Arial had to find the trident, maybe it could restore her to normal. She wish she hadn't placed it down so carelessly. She tried to remember where she left it

Ariel reached down and picked up the captain by the leg. The captain was very startled and started to scream. He was lifted up to Ariel's giant face. She wasn't happy either, and he could tell. The other pirates watched, having absolutely no idea where Ariel came from.

"Listen mortal! I'm the guardian of this village and I demand that you leave." Ariel said in a threatening voice. The citizens were surprised to see that she was defending them.

"Oh yeah? You don't scare me! We have taken on creatures far tougher than you!" The captain said, trying to act tough. Ariel smiled, catching him off guard.

"How about this then. If you don't leave now, I'll gobble you down whole. I'm sure you would make a fine snack."

"You're bluffing! Put me down now or I'll order my men to attack." Ariel shrugged.

"Fine, I warned you." Ariel dangled him over her open mouth. She dropped him, making him land on her tongue. He screamed, afraid that she was serious. Ariel closed her mouth and started to suck on him. The pirate tasted really good. She swirled him around, making sure to only scare him. However, if he refused to leave once more, she would swallow him for real. She spit him out onto her hand. He was soaking wet and terrified. "Since I'm nice, I'll give you one last chance. Leave and never return!" She said tightening her grip.

"Ok ok, I'll never come back! Please forgive me!" He cried, he didn't want to die to her. He was also afraid that if he didn't leave, she would also devour his comrades.

"Good, now get out of here, and never cause trouble again!" She said and dropped him back onto his boat. The pirate captain ordered to turn around and leave. Ariel watched them sail away. She was satisfied that she protected innocent people. She turned around to see the people cheering.

"Thank you! Thank you so much! We are sorry about how we treated you! Please, is there anything we can do to make it up?" One man said. Ariel gave a friendly smile.

New York City, the Big Apple, one of the most populate cities in the country. They say if you can make it here, you can make it anywhere. The people had they had seen it all, but nothing they have dealt with can prepare them for what is to come. Out of thin air, a 70 foot girl with with long blonde hair, she wears a cerulean blue knee-length dress, with a white pinafore apron on top. Underneath her dress, she wears a white petticoat, white stockings, white knee-length pantalettes, black strapped Mary Jane shoes and a black bow in her hair. Who is this girl and where did she come from?

Would you believe me if I told you she was Alice from Disney's 1951's classic movie? Alice had finally escape Wonderland, that strange place where logic wasn't welcome. But atlas, she further from home than ever. "At least I escape that beastly Queen," Alice sighed in relief. Then realize three things; she was now giant size again, and she was in a strange new place. "OH dear," She gasped. "How did I get so big? And where am I?" Her curiosity getting the better of her again, she decided to go look around.

Unfortunately for the citizens of the Big Apple, was a sweet and kid girl, she wasn't being careful and her footsteps causing tremors for the folk for the big city. She ended up putting a lot of china shops out of business. Not bothering where she was stepping, she crushed someone's fancy new car. And the worst part, he still had 3 payments left. Alice decides to look in one of the sky scraper building and finds to her surprise, there was tiny (to her) people living in them. And some of them did NOT like to be peek on.

"Oh dear!" She screamed. "There are people living in this city!" She was so caught up in looking at she never considered that anyone was living here. She then pushed down her dress and sees tiny people panic and scream at her feet. "Goodness," She said. "Please stop panicking. "I don't mean you any harm." But sadly the damage has been done. Suddenly Alice is over come by hunger as her stomach rumbles as loud as a rock concert. She loses her self and begins majority feeding frenzy, stealing food from all the city's fast food and restaurant food supplies.

As soon as she's finish, she returns to normal. "What just happened?" She asked, forgetting the food rampage she just went on. Then her stomach begins to hurt so much that she clutches her stomach, "OH WHAT NOW?!" she moans in pain. She lets loose a earth shaking burp that destroys ever window and ever thing else glass within 50 feet of her. Infact the burp is so powerful that she falls on her rear end, crushing a majority of the road. For the people of Yew York City, things couldn't get any worst. But unfortunately they could.

This was the final straw for poor not so little Alice. She was in a stranger new place. she was stuck as a giant with no way of getting back to normal. She had no one to help her, and everyone she might have asked for help wouldn't even dare get within 12 feet of her. Her butt was hurt. And she had no idea of how to get home. So was so frustrated that she starts to cry. And just like first time she became a giant, her giant tears started to flood the city.

What will happen to her now?
